page.title: 17Methodist Chapel, Farcet
page.content: We went to visit the Methodist Chapel in{Farcet.}The buiding was put up in 1908.In the foundations is a jar containing the names of children who helped to collect silver three-penny pieces to provide money for the building.Before the present chapel was built,people met together in a building in Middle Street.This is now a house. In the chapel there are seats for about one hundred and fifty people.As well as two sevices each Sunday there is a Sunday School, and a chidren's group meets on Thursday.The minister who takes the services has a chapel at Whittlesey too.The chapel is heated with a coke-burning stove.At the back of the chapel is a school room and a kitchen.
